title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 January 2012 - XWiki
content:

02:17 <sburjan`> has quit

06:02 <Denis> has quit  
06:26 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki

07:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:58 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:11 <@sdumitriu> Hey mflorea  
08:11 <+mflorea> Hi sdumitriu  
08:11 <@sdumitriu> I didn't have time to fix the tests yet, I've been debugging some code  
08:11 <@sdumitriu> But I noticed some flickers  
08:12 <+mflorea> yes, we have flickers too  
08:12 <@sdumitriu> extensions.xwiki.org returns 500 status code pretty often, so some tests will fail because of that  
08:13 <@sdumitriu> xwiki.org is really shitty lately  
08:15 <+mflorea> ok, there are two thing to do there, at least: (1) add an isPageTemplateProvider() method and don't try to exclude spaces when it returns false and (2) Fix the problem with the "edit this page to create it" link which recently points to a "create" form that has only a "Create" buton  
08:15 <+mflorea> this test (and others) expect the link to go directly on edit mode  
08:16 <+mflorea> I did (1) locally, but then I hit (2) because it asserts that the page is in edit mode after clicking that link. I didn't know if the new "create" form was added on purpose or it is a mistake. Looks strange anyway  
08:29 <vmassol> has quit  
08:52 <sburjan`> has quit  
08:52 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: I don't get (2)  
08:56 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: so you're saying that when you go to an unexisting page (using the URL address bar) and then click on the "edit this page to create it" link you go directly to edit mode? I doubt it.  
08:57 <+mflorea> in my case the link leads me to /bin/create/SomeSpace/SomeUnexistingPage  
08:57 <+mflorea> which displays a "Create" button  
08:57 <+mflorea> and if I click this button I'm taken to edit mode  
08:57 <@sdumitriu> It does go to /create/, but there's no button, it redirects to edit automatically  
08:58 <+mflorea> hmm, are you sure you don't have local changes?  
08:58 <+mflorea> on your XE  
08:58 <+mflorea> let me take the latest 3.4 snapshot  
08:58 <+mflorea> the one I have is from yesterday  
08:59 <@sdumitriu> I got a fresh one an hour ago  
09:00 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r6588b22 / (2 files in 2 dirs): [misc] Updating tests - http://git.io/ihUEHg  
09:01 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: You can ignore xwiki-enterprise-test-extension for the moment, I have to update those but it's going to take a while  
09:02 <+mflorea> ok  
09:02 <+mflorea> let me check the latest snapshot  
09:09 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: it doesn't redirect on my instance..  
09:10 <+mflorea> it stays on http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/create/Foo/Bar  
09:11 <@sdumitriu> OK...  
09:11 <@sdumitriu> Trying again  
09:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: I updated the quick release documentation, see if it's clear  
09:26 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: I got the Create button now...  
09:29 <+mflorea> looks simple enough :) about the gpg key, do I have it on maven machine?  
09:31 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:34 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: No  
09:37 <@sdumitriu> It's your own key, it's not shared, so you have to transfer your own key there first  
09:48 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rb3eaba0 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/CreateAction.java : XWIKI-7358: Add support for simple space templates ...  
09:48 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r48dd754 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/CreateAction.java : [misc] Applied codestyle - http://git.io/8NOeIw

10:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: good morning, would be great if you could put jira issues for your tasks on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap as Sergiu has done for his tasks  
10:12 <vmassol> mflorea: same for you  
10:18 <+tmortagne> vmassol: looking at it  
10:18 <vmassol> thanks  
10:20 <vmassol> stopping bot

11:37 <+tmortagne> mflorea: in DocumentContentDisplayer (219) you do  
11:37 <+tmortagne> throw new RuntimeException(e);  
11:38 <+tmortagne> the  message of the new exception is the tostring of e and  not the message of e, I think it would be nicer to do  
11:38 <+tmortagne> throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage(), e);  
11:38 <+tmortagne> WDYT ?  
11:38 <+tmortagne> right now I have something like:  
11:38 <+tmortagne> java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Cannot find section [unknown] in document [wiki:Space.DisplayedPage]  
11:38 <+tmortagne> [...]  
11:38 <+tmortagne> when printing the final exception  
11:38 <+mflorea> I thought that new RuntimeException(e) takes care of it  
11:39 <+tmortagne> well it is but it takes the  tostring and not the message, don't know why  
11:39 <+mflorea> if not, then sure, it's better to display the actual message of the exception  
11:39 <+tmortagne> trying to find an explanation in the javadoc  
11:40 <+tmortagne> they explicitly say that they use tostring in the javadoc but they don't explain why  
11:41 <+mflorea> ok, then we should change  
11:41 <+mflorea> are you working on it?  
11:41 <+tmortagne> yea I will take care of it since I have a unit test which validate the final exception message  
11:41 <+mflorea> ok  
12:00 <vmassol> mflorea: I don't see any done tasks in the roadmap on app within minutes is that normal?  
12:02 <+mflorea> yes, I was on holiday + I wrote functional tests + I've spent the start of this week to stabilize the build for the release  
12:02 <vmassol> you could add the tests in there no?  
12:02 <vmassol> (you don't have an issue for it?)  
12:03 <+mflorea> no, I don't have an issue  
12:03 <vmassol> ok...  
12:03 <+mflorea> I will return to AppWithinMinutes after the release  
12:03 <vmassol> k  
12:13 <+tmortagne> mflorea: there is a bug stack trace printed during xwiki-platform-gwt-dom unit tests, its that expected (note that the tests don't fail, it just don't looks very nice)  
12:13 <+tmortagne> ?  
12:13 <+tmortagne> s/bug/big/  
12:14 <+mflorea> afaik it is printed just once. if you build again it won't be printed anymore. I've searched a bit for a way to fix it but it seems it's a GWT bug/issue  
12:15 <+tmortagne> ok  
12:17 <+tmortagne> vmassol: do you know why bundle plugin produces warning like  
12:17 <+tmortagne> Jan 11, 2012 12:16:41 PM java.util.jar.Attributes read  
12:17 <+tmortagne> WARNING: Duplicate name in Manifest: Manifest-Version.  
12:17 <+tmortagne> Ensure that the manifest does not have duplicate entries, and  
12:17 <+tmortagne> that blank lines separate individual sections in both your  
12:17 <+tmortagne> manifest and in the META-INF/MANIFEST.MF entry in the jar file.  
12:17 <+tmortagne> Jan 11, 2012 12:16:41 PM java.util.jar.Attributes read  
12:17 <+tmortagne> WARNING: Duplicate name in Manifest: Created-By.  
12:17 <+tmortagne> Ensure that the manifest does not have duplicate entries, and  
12:17 <+tmortagne> that blank lines separate individual sections in both your  
12:17 <+tmortagne> manifest and in the META-INF/MANIFEST.MF entry in the jar file.  
12:17 <+tmortagne> Jan 11, 2012 12:16:41 PM java.util.jar.Attributes read  
12:17 <+tmortagne> WARNING: Duplicate name in Manifest: Built-By.  
12:17 <+tmortagne> Ensure that the manifest does not have duplicate entries, and  
12:17 <+tmortagne> that blank lines separate individual sections in both your  
12:17 <+tmortagne> manifest and in the META-INF/MANIFEST.MF entry in the jar file.  
12:17 <+tmortagne> Jan 11, 2012 12:16:41 PM java.util.jar.Attributes read  
12:17 <+tmortagne> WARNING: Duplicate name in Manifest: Build-Jdk.  
12:17 <+tmortagne> Ensure that the manifest does not have duplicate entries, and  
12:17 <+tmortagne> that blank lines separate individual sections in both your  
12:17 <+tmortagne> manifest and in the META-INF/MANIFEST.MF entry in the jar file.  
12:17 <+tmortagne> in most projects ? Is it normal or are we supposed to fix something you think ?  
12:18 <vmassol> tmortagne: I've seen them but haven't tried to analyze why yet  
12:19 <+tmortagne> ok  
12:21 <+tmortagne> looks like I'm done with include macro refactoring, there is not many modifications so I think it can go as it is in 3.3.1 and 3.2.1 (but without the display macro)  
12:21 <vmassol> cool  
12:21 <+tmortagne> but it mean introducing a new metadata in 3.3.1 and 3.2.1  
12:22 <vmassol> yeah ok  
12:22 <+tmortagne> that's the cleanest way IMO, going back to old hack would be painful  
12:22 <vmassol> yep

12:50 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r9b40c5f / (10 files): Update translations. - http://git.io/O5r\_zQ  
12:53 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r0fe0f9a / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/Main/Welcome.ru.xml : Update translations. - http://git.io/30lhzQ  
12:57 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* r3eb343f / (3 files in 3 dirs): XRENDERING-171: Introducing new metadata in to indicate the base reference to use to resolve references - http://git.io/U2pUXQ  
12:57 <CIA-121> tmortagne stable-3.3.x \* r21f337b / (3 files in 3 dirs): XRENDERING-171: Introducing new metadata in to indicate the base reference to use to resolve references ...  
12:57 <CIA-121> tmortagne stable-3.2.x \* r8c84239 / (3 files in 3 dirs): XRENDERING-171: Introducing new metadata in to indicate the base reference to use to resolve references - http://git.io/iWAAlg  
13:01 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* ra9e7d4d / (4 files in 4 dirs): XWIKI-7382: Include macro with context=current should resolve reference based on current document instead of source document - http://git.io/qoE77A  
13:01 <CIA-121> tmortagne stable-3.2.x \* r88e3db0 / (4 files in 4 dirs): XWIKI-7382: Include macro with context=current should resolve reference based on current document instead of source document ...  
13:02 <CIA-121> tmortagne stable-3.3.x \* r78c8621 / (4 files in 4 dirs): XWIKI-7382: Include macro with context=current should resolve reference based on current document instead of source document ...  
13:06 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* r4a29c0f / (6 files in 6 dirs): XWIKI-7383: Introduce display macro - http://git.io/uHF5eg  
13:08 <mflorea> tmortagne: there's something I don't understand re XEM translations  
13:10 <mflorea> the translations I get from l10n.xwiki.org for http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XEM/XEMWebHome don't match the Main.WebHome page from xwiki-manager-ui  
13:10 <mflorea> Main.WebHome is now a workspace home page, but the translations I get from l10n.xwiki.org are for XEM home page  
13:11 <mflorea> on the workspace home page there is a note that the old XEM home page was moved  
13:11 <mflorea> I guess we didn't update l10n.xwiki.org  
13:11 <Enygma`> must be partly my fault  
13:11 <mflorea> I'm not sure what to do with these translations  
13:12 <Enygma`> they need to be used for WikiManager.Dashboard now  
13:12 <tmortagne> mflorea: the en versoin is the good one or not even ?  
13:13 <tmortagne> since this one is supposed to be loaded from git evry days  
13:13 <mflorea> yes, the en version is good  
13:13 <mflorea> but the translations are bad  
13:13 <tmortagne> ok that's that normal indeed, we need to move the translation to the new location of the old home page  
13:13 <mflorea> they match the old home page  
13:14 <tmortagne> mflorea: just don't take them in to account for now  
13:14 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r7dd1015 / (3 files): Update translations. - http://git.io/Rnz4Fw  
13:14 <mflorea> ok, I'll ignore them  
13:14 <Enygma`> yes, they need to be moved to WikiManager.Dashboard... which will probably be moved into platform-wiki-manager, since I don`t think it's worth keeping it into XEM anymore  
13:14 <tmortagne> anyway if theses are the old one it mean you would have no translation if all was right  
13:21 <mflorea> has quit  
13:29 <sburjan> has quit  
13:48 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think the display macro is not correctly located  
13:48 <vmassol> my idea was to put it with the display module instead, wdyt?  
13:49 <vmassol> (this is what we've done for other  macros when we had a dedicated module)  
13:58 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes would be better, actually I did not think of display module, my logic was to put it where include macro was  
13:58 <tmortagne> moving it  
13:58 <vmassol> ok thanks  
13:58 <tmortagne> hmm  
13:58 <tmortagne> but we don't have display top level module  
13:58 <vmassol> you could create a top level display module  
13:58 <tmortagne> it's a unique module  
13:59 <vmassol> and have an -api + -macro sub modules  
13:59 <tmortagne> need to refactor that  
14:14 <tmortagne> vmassol: btw shoun't we put the cache macro in the cache module ?  
14:14 <vmassol> hmm yes I think that's a good idea  
14:14 <tmortagne> ok finishing with display macro and will look at it  
14:14 <vmassol> OTOH we'll need to find a good dir structure  
14:15 <vmassol> acutally  
14:15 <vmassol> it's the various implementation that could possibly go into a subdir  
14:15 <vmassol> but that's not important at this stage  
14:15 <tmortagne> nop  
14:31 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
14:31 <DrLou\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <vmassol> finishing xar upgrade of xwiki.org  
14:34 <lucaa> hi all ( vmassol )  
14:34 <vmassol> hi lucaa  
14:34 <lucaa> how can I disable emoticons transformation on a piece of content?  
14:34 <vmassol> {{{…}}}  
14:34 <lucaa> it's generated by a velocity macro  
14:34 <lucaa> which has wiki="false"  
14:34 <vmassol> {{{…}}} is verbatim  
14:34 <lucaa> and it doesn't really get disabled...  
14:35 <vmassol> it's not wiki syntax  
14:35 <lucaa> isn't it the same with  
14:35 <lucaa> {{velocity wiki="false" /}}  
14:35 <lucaa> ?  
14:35 <vmassol> the emoticon  
14:35 <lucaa> yes i know  
14:35 <vmassol> it's a transformation  
14:35 <vmassol> nothing to do with macros  
14:35 <lucaa> ok lemme try we'll see  
14:35 <vmassol> (which are also a transformation)  
14:36 <lucaa> omg  
14:36 <lucaa> so  
14:36 <vmassol> that  said it's a good faq I'll add it  
14:36 <vmassol> if xwiki.org lets me…. it's so slow....  
14:37 <lucaa> {{velocity wiki="false"}}$myVarWithEmoticons{{/velocity}}  
14:37 <lucaa> it's not the same as  
14:37 <lucaa> {{velocity}}{{{$myVarWithEmoticons}}}{{/velocity}}  
14:37 <lucaa> ?  
14:37 <vmassol> we really have a pb with xwii.org  
14:37 <vmassol> lucaa: it's different  
14:37 <vmassol> the first one  
14:37 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <vmassol> will generate a XDOM containing $myVarWithEmoticons  
14:38 <vmassol> the second one will genertae a XDOM with a VerbatimBlock and $myVarWithEmoticons inside a sub blocks  
14:38 <vmassol> then the icon tx will execute on the genertaed XDOM  
14:38 <lucaa> right, but what does wiki=false mean?  
14:38 <lucaa> as a parameter?  
14:38 <lucaa> shouldn't it prevent stuff to happen?  
14:38 <tmortagne> lucaa: it mean it does not parse it  
14:39 <tmortagne> i.e. it's a plain text  
14:39 <tmortagne> and not whatever the current syntax is  
14:39 <lucaa> ok, I might see technically what it means  
14:39 <lucaa> I mean it might make sense technically  
14:39 <tmortagne> so basically it parse it with plain/1.0 parser  
14:39 <lucaa> but as usage, you cannot expect anyone to understand that  
14:39 <vmassol> well you need to look at the doc for the "wiki" parameter  
14:40 <vmassol> we need to check if it's correct  
14:40 <lucaa> it's really really hard to understand what is the difference between the two  
14:40 <vmassol> it doesn't mean it's not generating wiki syntax  
14:40 <vmassol> it means the content is not considered wiki syntax  
14:40 <lucaa> right  
14:41 <lucaa> I see.. but it's really hard  
14:42 <tmortagne> the result should be the same, what wrong IMO is actually to have a verbatimblock since it just supposed to mean that the text inside {{{ }}} should not be parsed  
14:42 <tmortagne> see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-168  
14:43 <+mflorea> tmortagne: platform build is failing due to a compilation error. Can you check it?  
14:43 <lucaa> tmortagne: the result of what?  
14:44 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:44 <tmortagne1> mflorea: yes I know, i'm currently refactoring it anyway  
14:44 <+mflorea> ok  
14:45 <tmortagne1> lucaa: was refering to "lucaa: it's really really hard to understand what is the difference between the two"  
14:45 <tmortagne1> it's hard because verbatim behavior is wrong IMO  
14:46 <lucaa> tmortagne1: I was only having problems with emoticons being transformed on the first one (wiki="false") and not on the second one ({{{)  
14:46 <lucaa> so the result is not the same  
14:46 <lucaa> I think too that it should be the same  
14:46 <tmortagne1> lucaa: I know it's not the same, that's what i'm teling you  
14:46 <lucaa> but apparently no, it's normal that emoticons are transformed on the result on the macro  
14:47 <tmortagne1> the way emoticon are working is not very good anyway, it cant take into account escaping in transformations  
14:47 <tmortagne1> it's too late
